review: When Amazon first offered this at half-price for Prime members, I shrugged and said "Meh."  Then my brother showed me his in operation.  No longer "Meh," I ordered mine that day.  It arrived a good month ahead of schedule, too (kudos, Amazon!).  So, how does it perform?  The Fire TV Stick works *at least* as well as my AppleTV (both are playing through a Denon receiver on a Mitsubishi 65" 1080p DLP), and it's great having access to my Prime Movies and TV Shows on the big screen in my TV room.  The video is HD and the sound is quality stereo.  So far I have observed no buffering, video, or sound quality defects.  If you're trying to decide between the Fire TV Stick and an AppleTV (at twice the price)... honestly, it may just come down to brand loyalty.  Both have Netflix and other general favorites, so it is a question of which company you've bought more videos from.  If you are starting out fresh, and aren't already heavily invested in Apple Store movies and TV shows, I'd recommend going with the Fire Stick.  It costs less than half what the AppleTV does, and the video quality is on par between the two.  Additionally, Amazon Prime offers a fair amount of free programming (which Apple does not).  And, because the Fire TV Stick is so affordably priced, I'm not even upset that I didn't get this when it was half price! (Ah, who am I kidding?  I'm going to be kicking myself over that for a while!)

review: The fire stick is really nice.  It has higher specs than the Google Chrome-Cast and comes with a remote which is key to people who don't have smartphones or just simply want a separate physical remote.  The price is very good only 4 dollars more than the Chrome-Cast and about 10 dollars less than the Roku stick.  The overall all construction and quality is very good and it performs quite well.  The one thing that I don't really like is that you have to use the power adapter that comes with it instead of just powering it by USB.  But it makes sense considering that you can play games on the Fire TV Stick and games usually require more power.  This is the best streaming stick you can currently buy considering specs and practicality.  Also it can be used by almost anyone (including kids and grandparents).  If you are a Google enthusiast I would recommend sticking with the Chrome-Cast considering that it has it's own unique features like mirroring your Android phone screen and casting from various sources like from your desktop or phone.  Overall, the Fire TV Stick is a great all-in-one media streaming package at a wonderful price.
